title: The Zero Product Property
text: The zero product property says if the product of two quantities is zero, it must be that at least one of the quantities is zero.
speech: The zero product property says if the product of two quantities is zero, it must be that at least one of the quantities is zero.
pacedSpeech: The zero product property says if the product of two quantities is zero, it must be that at least one of the quantities is zero.

title: Factoring the Equation
text: We can factor $$4m^2-17m+15=0$$ to use the zero product property. $$4m^2-17m+15=(4m-5)(m-3)=0$$
speech: We can factor  4 m squared, minus 17 m plus 15 is equal to 0  to use the zero product property.  4 m squared minus 17 m plus 15 is equal to parentheses, 4 m minus 5,  times, parentheses m minus 3,  is equal to 0
pacedSpeech: We can factor   4 m squared, minus 17 m plus 15 is equal to 0
to use the zero product property.   4 m squared minus 17 m plus 15 is equal to , 4 m minus 5,  times,  m minus 3,  is equal to 0

title: Using the Zero Product Property
text: As per the zero product property, if $$(4m-5)(m-3)=0$$, then either $$4m-5$$ or $$m-3$$ is equal to $$0$$. Setting both of these to $$0$$, we get $$m=\frac{5}{4}$$ and $$m=3$$. Summing these values, we get $$4.25$$

Setting both of these to  0 , we get  m is equal to, 5 fourths  and  m, is equal to, 3 . Summing these values, we get  4.25
